title: Lakers leave future up to LeBron, extend Redick
content: While LeBron James enters his eighth season with the Lakers in a contract year, coach JJ Redick's future with the team is clear after being signed to an extension.

title: Bryson-Thomas to lead off U.S. team at Ryder Cup
content: Bryson DeChambeau and Justin Thomas will be paired in the the first match of foursomes (alternate-shot) at the Ryder Cup on Friday at Bethpage Black as captains for the respective teams unveiled their morning groups.

title: Prescott: Packers tilt not about 'Dak vs. Micah'
content: Dak Prescott said Sunday's matchup against the Packers isn't a "Dak vs. Micah" thing and knows the Week 4 game won't bring closure to Parsons' exit from Dallas, either.

title: Tua claps back at criticism from Cam, pundits
content: As Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa put it, talking about playing quarterback is a lot easier than actually playing the position.

title: 76ers' McCain tears UCL in thumb during workout
content: 76ers guard Jared McCain suffered a UCL tear in his right thumb in a workout Thursday, the team announced, casting his availability for the start of the season in doubt.

title: Oklahoma's Mateer says hand surgery a success
content: Oklahoma quarterback John Mateer on Thursday posted to social media that the procedure on a broken bone in his right hand was successful.

title: M's seek fan who gave Raleigh's 60th ball to boy
content: The Mariners are looking to connect with the man who gave a 12-year-old boy Cal Raleigh's 60th home run ball Wednesday night in Seattle.

title: Six NFL teams are 0-3: What's the problem, and what to expect
content: The Giants are going with Jaxson Dart at QB as history shows the difference between 1-3 and 0-4 is drastic for playoff hopes.

title: Week 4 buzz: What we're hearing on Dart, Penix and trade deadline talk
content: Here's the latest intel on the Giants starting Jaxson Dart, and Michael Penix Jr.'s struggles in Atlanta.

title: 'Our tradition to is to be untraditional': Inside the lifecycle of an Oregon uniform
content: Throughout the past two and a half decades, Oregon has pushed the envelope when it comes to uniforms.

title: Week 5 preview: Georgia-Alabama, key conference matchups, plus quarterbacks to know
content: Big conference matchups, quarterbacks that are making a name for themselves and more ahead of Week 5.

title: 'Beyond my wildest dreams': Keegan Bradley's journey from the slopes in Vermont to Ryder Cup captain
content: Keegan Bradley was never on the fast path to golf stardom. He grew up in New England and had to fight his way to the top of the game, where he finds himself this week at Bethpage Black.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Guardians rise, Mets and Tigers fall ahead of playoffs
content: The final days of the regular season are upon us -- and the wild-card races are coming down to the wire.

title: Stanley Cup contender rankings: Who dethrones the Panthers, Oilers?
content: It's been the same Cup Final matchup in consecutive years. Here are the teams that can change that in 2025-26.

title: Ovi breaks another Gretzky record? Bold predictions for every NHL team
content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

title: Which major NFL trades look better -- or worse -- in hindsight? Barnwell's fresh takes on 23 recent swaps
content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 4
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: What it's like for former Cowboys stars -- such as Micah, Emmitt, DeMarcus, Zeke -- to return to Dallas as an opponent
content: Micah Parsons will follow in the footsteps of Emmitt Smith, DeMarcus Ware and Ezekiel Elliott on Sunday as an opponent at AT&T Stadium.

title: How a historic trade in February has helped shape the WNBA semifinals
content: The biggest trade in WNBA history happened last February. Now a player involved in that deal will win a WNBA title.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: The 2025 WNBA semifinals are underway, and Phoenix beat Minnesota in OT in an instant classic Tuesday.

title: Why clubs shouldn't freeze players out, like Chelsea are doing with Raheem Sterling
content: The trend of players having to train away from the first team -- like Chelsea's Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi -- is a reminder that clubs hold an unfair amount of leverage.

title: Will Tessmann leapfrog McKennie, Musah to start for USMNT at 2026 World Cup?
content: Tanner Tessmann hasn't represented the U.S. since March, but he has been so good at Lyon in 2025-26 that Mauricio Pochettino can't keep ignoring him.

title: Lost seasons, disastrous drafts and fans rooting for the visiting team: Inside the Rockies' road to rock bottom
content: As Colorado nears the finish of one of the worst seasons in MLB history. Here's why the decline was a long time coming.

title: For A's fans, new city, same anger
content: A year after the move to West Sacramento, franchise still grapples with low attendance and outrage at owner.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Reyes halt Ulberg's winning streak at UFC Fight Night?
content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night from Perth, Australia? MMA analysts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: College football best bets for Week 5: Why UK matches up well with South Carolina
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 5 of the college football season, including what to expect when Kentucky heads to South Carolina.

title: Early men's Bracketology: Houston stays No. 1, Virginia gives ACC hope
content: The new Cavaliers coach is tasked with winning as big as the coach he once beat in a historic upset. Can it be done in Year 1?

title: What Bruce Pearl's retirement means for Auburn, college basketball
content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season.

title: Alonso's first F1 title, 20 years later: 'He was just another level'
content: Twenty years after winning his first F1 championship, Fernando Alonso is still on the grid, still revered, and still hungry for another world title.

title: West Virginia, Boise State lead best uniforms from college football Week 5
content: West Virginia will don a look that throws things back all the way to 1965, while Boise State is making waves with incredibly detailed, hand-painted helmets.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Ladakh violence: J&K CM Abdullah defends Congress, accuses BJP of blaming others for its failures
content: Mr. Abdullah said the Lieutenant Governor-led Ladakh administration should see why it failed in the first place to take necessary measures to maintain peace

title: Rajasthan man arrested on charges of espionage for Pakistan in Jaisalmer
content: Rajasthan CID Intelligence arrests Hanif Khan, a suspected Pakistani spy, for allegedly sharing confidential Indian Army information with Pakistan’s intelligence agency

title: A rare custom continues: deities are taken to Thiruvananthapuram from  Kanniyakumari
content: A few days before the Navaratri celebrations, a spectacular event takes place in Kanniyakumari district, once part of the erstwhile Travancore. Its history dates back to more than 200 years. Even today, it reminds the local people of the strong cultural bonds between Tamil Nadu and Kerala beyond political boundaries

title: A place linked to soldiers for long
content: The Defence Services Staff College was relocated from Quetta, Pakistan, to Wellington only after Independence. But the Nilgiris had a long association with soldiers. The British opened a depot in the mountains for its regiments to convalesce in 1862

title: Time is running out for the dolmens of Kodaikanal dating back to 5,000 years
content: Only less than 50% of the dolmens, recorded by Reverend A. Anglade S.J. and Reverend L. V. Newton S.J., are standing in the hills. At Pethuparai, dolmens have been fenced by the Archaeological Survey of India. At Thandikudi, they are vanishing, and some have disappeared under thick vegetation. More measures are needed to preserve them

title: Terrorism ‘persistent threat’ to development: EAM Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar emphasises the need to combat terrorism and reform multilateralism for global stability and development

title: Mohan Majhi government plans to strengthen cooperative movement in Odisha in a big way
content: Creation of unified marketing brand—under the name of either Utkal or Kalinga—to promote Odisha’s products in international markets has been mooted

title: Six arrested in Amritsar with 4 k.g. heroin, 2 pistols: Punjab Police
content: Preliminary investigation revealed that the accused persons were in touch with a Pakistan-based handler named Shah through social media, the DGP said

title: Outrage over infant deaths in Indore | In India’s cleanest city, rats in a hospital
content: Two infants died this September after rats bit them in the NICU of a government hospital in Indore, sparking outrage. However, the Madhya Pradesh government claims that the cause of death was pre-existing medical conditions. Mehul Malpani reports on the gaps in hygiene and safety standards in decades-old facilities and the overburdened public healthcare system in the State

title: On Devi Lal birth anniversary, INLD takes the fight to the Hoodas in Rohtak
content: Mr. Chautala promised to provide free electricity and double the old age pension on returning to power

title: Palestine issue not a Muslim-Jew conflict, but a humanitarian crisis: Ambassador
content: Abdullah M. Abu Shawesh addresses ‘Gaza Solidarity Conference’ organised by the Indian Union Muslim League. Recalling that India was among the first nations to recognise the State of Palestine, he says India’s solidarity with Palestine stems from a shared history

title: Helping Gen Z percussionists find their rhythm
content: ‘Gen Z Beats’, an initiative to build a national network of young tabla artistes from Kerala, is set to begin this December under the leadership of percussionist Arjun Kaliprasad

title: Telangana to introduce breakfast scheme in schools, 69% reservation in local bodies: Revanth Reddy
content: Tamil Nadu is a leader in education, nutrition and sports, and all other States are inspired by its education model, says Telangana Chief Minister

title: Social and Educational survey: Over 1.82 lakh households in Karnataka covered in four days
content: The State-wide Social and Educational survey being undertaken by the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes entered its fourth day with mixed progress across districts

title: SPV modalities being readied for shipbuilding cluster at Dugarajapatnam, says Minister
content: The State government has issued guidelines for promoting shipbuilding cluster and announced financial incentives, exemptions and subsidies, says Janardhan Reddy

title: Indrakeeladri in Vijayawada witnesses VIP rush, chaos during Kumkum Archana
content: Many women fail to take part in rituals, despite having tickets; devotees complain that they are made to wait for hours while VIPs are given a priority

title: Connect with workers, build teams, Congress tells leaders
content: Using a quote from former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge says, “Congress should maintain close ties with those millions of voiceless people whom it represents”

title: A.P. Assembly passes amendment Bill on Building Penalisation Scheme
content: The government plans to introduce a new penalisation framework targeting unauthorised constructions and deviations from sanctioned building plans up to August 31, 2025

title: Experts underline importance of blending technical and managerial skills in jobs
content: Seminar on ‘Careers in Management, Technology and Sciences’ organised by The Hindu FIC focusses on business analytics and data-driven decision making

title: IRCTC to run ‘Bhavya Gujarat’ special train from  October 7 to 16
content: Originating from Secunderabad, the train will cover Dwaraka, Somnath, Ahmedabad, Patan and Statue of Unity

title: Battle for No. 1: Draisaitl, Pastrnak and the players to consider
content: Six players have a chance at being the No. 1 pick in fantasy hockey drafts, and we look at each one is deserving.

title: Bengaluru to get adaptive traffic signals at 110 junctions
content: The Karnataka Cabinet approved installation of adaptive traffic signals at 110 busy junctions in Bengaluru city, to ease traffic movement

title: Artificial Intelligence and Gaming Lab inaugurated at Government Sri Krishnarajendra Silver Jubilee Technological Institute
content: The Department of Higher Education is working towards enhancing the skills of students in government engineering colleges by providing all facilities available in private educational institutions to government engineering colleges as well

title: India, Russia discuss BRICS grain exchange plan to boost agriculture trade ties
content: “Discussed ways to strengthen our win-win cooperation in agriculture, fertilizers and food processing,” says Modi  after meeting Russian Deputy Prime Minister Dmitry Patrushev

title: Azim Premji declines Karnataka CM’s request to open Wipro campus for public traffic movement
content: In a letter he said that it is “an exclusive private property owned by a listed company, not meant for public thoroughfare.”

title: A bumpy ride on highways with misery for company
content: Under-construction stretches of NH 544 and NH 66, which have long overshot deadlines, are posing huge problems for motorists as well as those residing near the project sites. Mini Muringatheri interacts with both parties to highlight their plight and the continuing apathy of the authorities

title: Delhi court lifts gag order that banned journalist Paranjoy Guha Thakurta from reporting on Adani Enterprises
content: Trial court asked to pass a fresh order in the matter after hearing the applicants on Friday, September 26; Mr. Thakurta not required to follow the gag order till fresh orders passed

title: Leh remains tense a day after death of four persons
content: Curfew clamped in the town, which witnessed violent protests; dozens of people detained; bodies of people killed handed over to families for last rites; at least 15 suffered serious injuries, says DGP

title: KKRTC to operate 500 extra buses to clear Dasara rush
content: These extra services will run from district, taluk centres in Kalyana Karnataka to Bengaluru and Tuljapur in Solapur district of Maharashtra

title: Madras High Court judges to inspect Tiruvannamalai Arunachaleswarar Temple
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and S. Sounthar take the decision due to complaints regarding certain constructions being put up inside the temple premises

title: Corrupt Ministers will not be spared, says Palaniswami
content: DMK men have been threatening quarry owners and demanding ₹100 for every tonne of m-sand, p-sand and blue metal mined across Tamil Nadu, says the AIADMK leader

title: Kudumbashree to expand FNHW activities
content: Goal is to develop culture of health and sports education among people; activities to be implemented in coordination with other departments

title: Amid shortage of fertilizers in Uttar Pradesh, Opposition alleges farmers stressed over government inaction
content: In viral videos shared online, farmers could be seen standing in long queues for hours and failing to receive the fertilizers and seeds due to apparent shortage

title: CPI(M) leader’s comments on Mamkootathil’s “partner in crime” create row
content: Shafi Parambil, MP, condemns CPI(M) Palakkad district secretary E.N. Suresh Babu’s “libellous slander.” Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan says the MP will sue Babu for the slight

title: Air India crash: Captain’s grieving father says investigators insinuated son cut fuel to flight’s engines
content: Initial probe said one pilot asked another why he cut the fuel; Captain's father accuses Indian investigators of 'procedurally improper' remarks; pilots' union condemns investigators' visit to father in Mumbai

title: Government revokes FCRA licence of Wangchuk’s organisation
content: A day after Leh unrest, for which the government blamed Sonam Wangchuk’s “provocative statements”, the Home Ministry cancels FCRA nod to SEMCOL; the alleged violations include accepting foreign funds to study “national sovereignty” and poor recordkeeping

title: HC asks lawyer why he failed to notice disclaimer on smoking on the back cover of Arundhati Roy’s book Mother Mary Comes To Me
content: The petitioner lawyer Rajasimhan had filed a PIL seeking a stay on the sale of the book whose cover photo shows her smoking a ‘bidi’

title: Election Commission of India to tweak counting process for postal ballots
content: Till now, counting of postal ballots would begin from 8 a.m. and the EVM rounds at 8.30 a.m; the poll body has decided that the penultimate round of EVM counting will start only after all the postal ballots are accounted for

title: Focus on State highways, tourism corridors and inter-State routes to fill gaps in Kerala’s EV charging network, says new report
content: Cities like Kochi, Thiruvananthapuram and Kozhikode exhibit strong coverage, while rural belts lag behind, cites a report by KSEB’s EV Accelerator Cell

title: Students continue to protest over paper leak in Uttarakhand, demand CBI inquiry
content: Protesting students allege that the BJP government’s anti-cheating law, that came into force in 2023, is no deterrent for the cheating mafia

title: BRS govt. spent a fraction of capital expenditure on education and health sectors, says CAG report
content: CAG report says only ₹2,550 crore out of Capex of ₹2.55 lakh crore spent on education related activities

title: e-waste collection drive to be expanded to Kerala’s panchayats too
content: The collection drive, by Haritha Karma Sena volunteers, began on pilot basis in December 2024 in a few municipalities and panchayats. Later in July this year, it was expanded to all Corporations

title: 60 detained after communal clashes erupt in Gujarat over WhatsApp status message
content: The conflict erupted over a WhatsApp status message referencing an ongoing social media trend on the declarations “I love Muhammad” or “I love Mahadev”

title: Karnataka High Court declines to stop caste survey, but imposes conditions for conducting it
content: Court says people have to be informed that participation in survey is not mandatory and they should not be persuaded to answer queries

title: Watch: PM Modi flags off three Vande Bharat trains, unveils ₹1 lakh crore projects in Rajasthan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated projects worth over ₹1 lakh crore in Banswara, Rajasthan, including the 2,800 MW Mahi-Banswara nuclear power project. He also flagged off three new Vande Bharat Express trains, underscoring the government’s push for clean energy and modern infrastructure.

title: Telangana to take over Hyderabad Metro Phase 1 from L&T in ₹15,000-crore deal
content: The development follows discussions between Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy and L&T Chairman & Managing Director S.N. Subrahmanyan, along with other senior officials, to resolve issues and pave the way for the second phase of the metro project

title: Govt. medical college teachers in Kerala to intensify stir
content: KGMCTA accuses the State government of ignoring their grievances related to the release of salary and dearness allowance arrears, anomalies in the pay structure of the entry-level cadre, and the creation of new posts in newly sanctioned GMCs

title: Compensation for sinking of MSC Elsa 3: HC reduces security amount to ₹1,227.62 cr.
content: This is a modification of its order of July 7 in an admiralty suit filed by the State government, following which its sister vessel MSC Akiteta-2 had been detained at Vizhinjam. The government had claimed ₹9,531 crore as compensation, mainly for the marine and coastal pollution and the loss caused to fishers

title: US-Pak ties: Trump meets Shehbaz Sharif, Asim Munir; praises leaders
content: Donald Trump met with Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and army chief Asim Munir, praising them as "great leaders." This meeting, following a recent trade deal and a brief encounter at the UN, signals a shift in Trump's stance towards Pakistan. Trump also emphasized Pakistan's strategic importance in Afghanistan, particularly regarding the Bagram Air Base.

title: 'Young people really wanted this': Trump approves TikTok deal with China; US takeover set
content: Donald Trump signed an executive order finalizing a deal allowing TikTok to operate in the US, with a majority stake moving to US investors like Oracle and Silver Lake. ByteDance will retain less than 20% equity. Much is still unknown about the actual arrangement, but Trump said Chinese President Xi Jinping “gave us the go-ahead” to proceed with the deal.

title: India ties hit as it backs & hosts Hasina: Muhammad Yunus
content: Muhammad Yunus criticized India for supporting Sheikh Hasina, alleging it strained relations due to India's disapproval of student protests against her. He accused Hasina of crimes and requested her extradition, while also dismissing reports of rising Islamic fundamentalism in Bangladesh as false. Yunus further suggested India was hindering SAARC's progress, emphasizing the need for regional cooperation.

title: Asia Cup: ‘Put them under pressure' - Pak coach fires stern warning to India before final clash
content: Pakistan's coach, Mike Hesson, has urged his team to concentrate on cricket ahead of their historic Asia Cup final against India, despite recent controversies and heightened tensions. India has dominated recent encounters, winning both matches in the tournament and holding a seven-match winning streak against Pakistan.

title: B'luru traffic chaos: Wipro rejects CM's request - his 'no silver bullet' reply
content: Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah requested Wipro to allow public vehicular access through its Bengaluru campus to alleviate traffic congestion on the Outer Ring Road. Azim Premji declined, citing operational, security, and legal concerns related to the campus's status as a Special Economic Zone. Wipro proposed funding a comprehensive study for long-term solutions.

title: ‘Better to die than face this’: 73-yr-old deported after 30 yrs in US
content: Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old woman who lived in the US for 30 years, faced deportation after her asylum applications were denied. During her detention, she was allegedly denied proper medical care, food, and basic hygiene.

title: Bill Gates credits 15 Indian engineers, says they built Microsoft; viral video
content: Amidst H-1B visa fee hikes and debates, a resurfaced video shows Bill Gates recalling Microsoft's early recruitment of Indian engineers from IITs in the 1980s. Gates emphasizes that this decision was crucial for Microsoft's growth, despite initial criticism about brain drain and concerns over American jobs.

title: PM Modi to officials: Don't wait for me, fix project delays
content: Prime Minister Modi has directed top bureaucrats and state chief secretaries to proactively address infrastructure project delays, rather than waiting for central intervention. During a Pragati meeting, he inquired about disciplinary actions against responsible officials.

title: Asia Cup: Pakistani fan goes viral shaking hands with Haris Rauf - Watch
content: A viral video of a Pakistani fan's provocative message to Haris Rauf has intensified the India-Pakistan rivalry ahead of the Asia Cup final. This incident, coupled with previous controversial gestures from Pakistani players, has fueled the tension. While Pakistan's captain asserts their team's ability, India aims to win and demonstrate that sportsmanship triumphs over theatrics and provocation.

title: Joe Rogan questions truth behind Charlie Kirk shooting, hints at cover-up
content: Joe Rogan has cast doubt on the official narrative surrounding the Charlie Kirk shooting, where the conservative activist tragically died. Rogan highlighted unusual details, such as a decoy suspect and the alleged use of a World War I rifle by the shooter, Tyler Robinson. Robinson, now in custody, faces multiple charges, including aggravated murder, with prosecutors seeking the death penalty.

title: US H-1B $100K fees: Netflix calls it “tax"; founder says it will end lotteries
content: Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings supports Donald Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, a move that contrasts with the widespread criticism from Silicon Valley leaders. While Hastings believes the fee will ensure H-1B visas are reserved for high-value jobs, the White House clarified it's a one-time payment for new petitions only, causing confusion and concern among tech companies, especially startups.

title: India's forest cover expanded by mere 2.5% in 10 yrs but 'very dense' cover grew 22.7%
content: India's forest cover saw a modest 2.5% increase between 2010-11 and 2021-22, with a significant 22.7% surge in very dense forests, signaling successful conservation. While moderately dense forests experienced a decline, open forests also expanded. The government's report highlights improved forest condition regarding biomass and carbon storage, but warns of regeneration challenges and fire risks.

title: Asia Cup: Massive statement! Pakistan captain drops bombshell on India ahead of final
content: Pakistan clinched a narrow 11-run victory against Bangladesh in a Super 4s Asia Cup match, securing their place in the final against India. Captain Salman Ali Agha praised his team's exceptional quality, highlighting Shaheen Shah Afridi's all-round performance. Bangladesh's captain, Jaker Ali, attributed their loss to poor batting, despite commendable bowling efforts.

title: Will Sam Darnold play tonight vs Cardinals? Injury update
content: Seattle Seahawks will face Arizona Cardinals. All eyes are on quarterback Sam Darnold. He is fit to play. Coach Mike Macdonald praised Darnold's recent performance. Darnold highlighted the team's preparation and execution. The match is scheduled to begin at 8:15 p.m. ET. Fans are eager to witness the game. The team is hoping for a victory.

title: Anna Kournikova shows baby bump at Miami event, expecting 4th child
content: Anna Kournikova, 44, made a rare appearance in Miami, revealing her pregnancy with her fourth child with Enrique Iglesias. Spotted with her son Nicholas, her baby bump was visible, confirming earlier reports. The couple, together since 2001, already have three children and are reportedly very happy to be expanding their family.

title: Andre Agassi & Steffi Graf net worth 2025: Legacy, family & fortune
content: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf, tennis legends with a combined fortune of $290 million in 2025, continue to impact the sport. Agassi captained Team World to victory at the Laver Cup, while Graf dedicates her time to family and charitable endeavors. Their children, Jaden and Jaz, were seen supporting their father at the Laver Cup, highlighting their enduring family legacy.

title: 'Double standards evident': EAM takes a shot at US over Russian oil; sends big message on terror
content: S Jaishankar addressed the G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting, criticizing double standards in energy purchases, particularly regarding Russian oil, and emphasizing the need for dialogue and diplomacy to address global conflicts. He highlighted the impact of conflicts in Ukraine and Gaza on the Global South, urging stronger energy and economic security. Jaishankar stressed the importance of multilateral reforms and combating terrorism.

title: On 80-yr-old's plea, SC orders eviction of his 61-yr-old son
content: The Supreme Court intervened in a poignant case, ordering a 61-year-old man to vacate his elderly parents' Mumbai properties. The octogenarian couple sought relief under the Maintenance and Welfare of Senior Citizens Act after their son failed to provide mandated support.

title: 'Charlie helped me a lot!': Trump hails TikTok; credits late MAGA star for campaign use
content: Donald Trump approved a deal for TikTok. American investors will take over the platform. Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison is involved. Trump mentioned Charlie Kirk's influence on his TikTok use. ByteDance will retain a minority stake. US investors will control the algorithm. The deal awaits final investor determination. Oracle will play a significant role.

title: Wankhede sues Aryan Khan's show for defamation
content: Sameer Wankhede, the former NCB zonal director, has filed a defamation suit in Delhi High Court against the makers of 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood,' a Netflix series directed by Aryan Khan. Wankhede seeks ₹2 crore in damages, alleging the series negatively portrays anti-drug enforcement and maligns his reputation.

title: Madison Beer opens up on dating struggles, feeling unsafe after breakups
content: Rumors of a romance between Los Angeles Chargers' quarterback Justin Herbert and pop star Madison Beer have ignited fan frenzy. Despite being spotted on dates, both stars remain tight-lipped. Beer's past comments about finding love have resurfaced, contrasting with Herbert's denial of any romantic involvement, fueling further speculation as Beer is seen supporting him at games.

title: SIT questions Zubeen Garg drummer; homes searched
content: Assam police are investigating the death of singer Zubeen Garg, questioning his drummer and searching homes following public outrage and multiple FIRs. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma recalled his past warnings about the exploitation of the singer by those close to him.

title: Step up lending for public infra, MSMEs: FM Sitharaman to banks
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urged banks with strong balance sheets to increase lending for public infrastructure, industry, and MSMEs, emphasizing their crucial role amid global uncertainty. She highlighted India's resilience due to strong economic fundamentals and urged public sector banks to maintain professional management and customer-centric approaches. The government is emphasizing increased capital for MSMEs to aid expansion and recovery.

title: Just 5% of US staff on H-1B visas: Accenture
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet downplayed H-1B visa concerns, stating only 5% of their US workforce relies on them. The company's headcount decreased by 11,419 in Q4, part of a business optimization program involving talent rotation and divestitures. Despite this, FY25 revenue rose 7%, with growth across all verticals and geographies, and the operating margin expanded to 15.6%.

title: Ensure day-to-day trials in criminal cases, SC tells HCs
content: The Supreme Court has directed high courts to ensure day-to-day trials in criminal cases, especially sensitive ones, citing concerns about delays and the current social and political climate. The court expressed disappointment over the abandonment of continuous trials, which were common three decades ago.

title: School dropout rates halved in 2 years, says govt report
content: India's school system is showing remarkable progress, with dropout rates significantly declining across all levels, according to a recent MoSPI survey. The survey highlights that dropout rates have nearly halved in just two years, especially at the preparatory and middle school levels. Experts attribute this positive shift to government initiatives like expanded mid-day meals and infrastructure improvements.

title: 'Haven’t liked it at all': Donald Trump slams Russia, Putin on Ukraine
content: Donald Trump voiced his disapproval of Russia's actions and Vladimir Putin's leadership. He highlighted Russia's economic struggles and called their war effort aimless. Trump mentioned potential Ukrainian reclamation of territory with EU and NATO support. He stated the US will continue providing weapons to NATO.

title: Charlie Kirk’s harsh attacks on Taylor Swift resurface amid his death
content: Following Charlie Kirk's death, his old derogatory post targeting Taylor Swift has resurfaced. In 2018, Kirk criticized Swift for endorsing a Democrat and questioning Marsha Blackburn's stance on women's issues. Swift had openly opposed Blackburn's views on LGBTQ+ rights and women's rights. The resurfaced post has drawn attention amid the controversy surrounding Kirk's assassination.

title: 48 detained, calm prevails in curfew-bound Leh after violence over Sixth Schedule
content: Following violent protests in Leh over statehood and Sixth Schedule status, police detained 48 people after four deaths and numerous injuries. A heavy curfew is in place as investigations begin into the use of force, while political figures urge restraint and dialogue. The unrest stems from delays in addressing Ladakh's demands since it became a Union Territory.

title: Defence ministry inks deal with HAL for 97 more Tejas jets
content: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) secured a Rs 66,500-crore contract to deliver 97 Tejas Mark-1A fighters to the Indian Air Force (IAF) starting 2027-28. This follows delays in the delivery of the initial 83 jets ordered in 2021, primarily due to delayed engine supplies from General Electric. HAL anticipates delivering two aircraft next month, with GE promising increased engine deliveries soon.

title: Modi-Bibi ties have led to govt silence on 'genocide': Sonia Gandhi
content: Sonia Gandhi criticized India's silence on Palestine, attributing it to the personal friendship between PM Modi and Israeli PM Netanyahu, rather than India's values or interests. She argued that this personalized diplomacy undermines India's foreign policy and historical stance on freedom and human dignity. Sonia emphasized that silence equates to complicity.

title: Criminal law can't become means to settle scores: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has cautioned against misusing criminal law to settle personal vendettas, criticizing the increasing trend of filing FIRs in civil disputes. The court emphasized the duty of High Courts to intervene and prevent the abuse of legal processes, particularly when criminal proceedings are used to exert pressure in civil matters.

title: Poor financial condition most dominant driver of child marriage, states report
content: A recent report indicates that poverty remains the primary driver of child marriage in India, although cases have declined in villages over the past three years. The study, conducted across five states, highlights that financial constraints, perceived need for protection, and cultural practices contribute to the issue.

title: Centre cancels FCRA licence of Wangchuk's NGO
content: The Union home ministry has cancelled the FCRA license of Sonam Wangchuk's NGO, Students Educational and Cultural Movement of Ladakh, citing alleged violations. These violations include depositing locally generated funds into the FCRA account, diverting funds for impermissible activities like studying the country's sovereignty, and failing to deposit foreign funds in the designated account.

title: Former Arsenal striker Billy Vigar dies after collapse at Wingate match
content: Football world mourns the tragic passing of 21-year-old Billy Vigar, a Chichester City striker and former Arsenal academy player. Vigar collapsed during a match against Wingate & Finchley, suffering a serious brain injury. Despite surgery, he passed away, prompting heartfelt tributes from Chichester City, Arsenal, Derby County, and across the football community.

title: Latest Agni-Prime test-fired from rail-based launcher
content: India successfully tested the Agni-Prime missile. The missile has a range of 2,000km. It was launched from a rail-based system. This enhances its mobility and survivability. The Agni-Prime will replace older missiles. India is also strengthening its naval nuclear capabilities. The INS Aridhaman will be commissioned soon. This will further boost India's defense capabilities.

title: Maple Leafs vs Canadiens: Cowan and Maccelli lead preseason roster
content: The Toronto Maple Leafs are set to face the Montreal Canadiens in a preseason game, emphasizing youth and depth. Easton Cowan, after a strong start, earns a top-line role, while Matias Maccelli aims to prove his worth on the second line. Dennis Hildeby is slated to start in goal, and Nick Robertson's absence raises questions about his future role.

title: Congress raises Mandal pitch as Kharge slams caste rally ban in UP
content: Congress is aggressively advocating for social justice by criticizing the UP government's ban on caste-based political rallies. Mallikarjun Kharge questioned PM Modi about the ban's compatibility with the acceptance of caste census, linking it to protests against caste atrocities. This stance aligns with Congress's new Mandalite fervor, driven by Rahul Gandhi's focus on pro-poor politics and reservations.

title: Poll sop: PM to transfer Rs 10,000 each to 75L Bihar women today
content: In a significant move ahead of the Bihar polls, PM Modi will launch the Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana via video-conferencing on Friday. The initiative aims to empower women by directly transferring Rs 10,000 to 75 lakh women's bank accounts across Bihar.

title: Asia Cup: First time ever! Pakistan beat B'desh, set up final against India
content: In a thrilling Asia Cup Super Fours match, Pakistan overcame Bangladesh by 11 runs, securing their place in the final against India. Despite a shaky start and impressive bowling from Bangladesh, Pakistan's lower order propelled them to a total of 135. A stunning bowling effort helped them edge out Bangladesh to set up a final against rivals India.

title: Starting with Bihar, EC tweaks rules for counting postal ballots
content: The Election Commission has reinstated the prior rule mandating the complete counting of postal ballots before the penultimate round of EVM/VVPAT counts. This revision, set to debut in the upcoming Bihar assembly polls, reverses the 2019 guideline that allowed EVM counting to proceed regardless of the postal ballot stage.

title: Dharmendra Pradhan, Haryana BJP win mastermind, to lead Bihar campaign
content: Dharmendra Pradhan will spearhead the BJP's campaign for the upcoming Bihar elections, supported by C R Patil and Keshav Prasad Maurya. Bhupender Yadav is appointed election in-charge for West Bengal, assisted by Biplab Kumar Deb. Baijayant 'Jay' Panda will oversee the Tamil Nadu campaign, with Murlidhar Mohol as co-in-charge.

title: Trump Allies To Control TikTok Under New US Deal
content: Donald Trump on Thursday signed an executive order laying out a proposed deal for a US version of TikTok that would see Chinese ownership reduced to 20 percent and put control in the hands of the president's allies.

title: Trump Announces New Tariffs: 100% On Drugs, 50% On Kitchen Cabinets, Others
content: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he will put import taxes of 100% on pharmaceutical drugs, 50% on kitchen cabinets and bathroom vanities, 30% on upholstered furniture and 25% on heavy trucks starting on Oct. 1.

title: Former FBI Director And Trump Critic James Comey Indicted On Two Charges
content: Former FBI director and prominent Donald Trump critic James Comey has been indicted on two counts, US media reported Thursday, as the US president escalated a campaign of legal retribution against political foes.

title: Microsoft Cuts Off Some Services To Israeli Military Over Gaza Surveillance
content: Microsoft on Thursday said it cut an Israeli defense unit's access to some cloud services apparently being used as part of a mass surveillance operation in Gaza.

title: Trump Signs Order To Put TikTok Under US Ownership, Says China Agreed
content: President Donald Trump has signed an executive order that he says will allow TikTok to continue operating in the United States in a way that meets national security concerns laid out by the law.

title: Trump Says Spoke To Netanyahu, "Pretty Close" To Gaza Deal
content: US President Donald Trump said he spoke to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday amid a push to end the war in Gaza, adding that he believed a ceasefire deal was "pretty close."

title: 47-Year-Old Man Arrested On Charges Of Espionage In Rajasthan's Jaisalmer
content: A man was arrested on Thursday in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer district on charges of espionage for Pakistan's intelligence agency ISI, a senior police official said.

title: Trump Urges Turkey's Erdogan To Stop Buying Russian Oil
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday urged Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to stop buying Russian oil over the war in Ukraine, while hinting that he may drop a ban on Ankara buying US stealth fighter jets.

title: Violence Outside House Of Zubeen Garg's Manager, Batons Used On Protesters
content: The situation near the house of Siddhartha Sharma - manager of the late singer Zubeen Garg --- became tense today after the police resorted baton charge to disperse an agitated mob.

title: Rights Issue Used To Pay Ransom? SEBI Bans Seacoast Shipping From Raising Funds For 5 Years
content: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has barred Seacoast Shipping Services Limited (SSSL) and its key officials from raising funds from investors for five years, after finding the company guilty of diverting rights issue proceeds.

title: From Living In Relief Camp To Medical College, Manipur Student's Journey
content: Shitaljit Tongbram, 21, walked to his grandmother's house in Churachandpur carrying two t-shirts on the evening of May 3, 2023, the day Meitei-Kuki ethnic clashes began across Manipur.

title: Trump Administration Threatens Mass Firings As Shutdown Looms
content: US President Donald Trump's administration dramatically raised the stakes Thursday in a clash over a possible government funding shutdown, telling federal agencies to prepare for new mass firings if it goes ahead.

title: UN Appoints Indian-Origin Amita Chaudhary To Chair Global Sustainable Insurance Board
content: Indian-origin Amita Chaudhury has been appointed the Chair of the Board of the United Nations Environment Programme Finance Initiative (UNEP FI) Principles for Sustainable Insurance (PSI).

title: Iran Carried Out An Undeclared Missile Test Despite War With Israel
content: Iran has likely carried out an undeclared missile test at its Imam Khomeini Spaceport, satellite photos showed Thursday, underlining Tehran's effort to maintain its weapons program despite the 12-day war with Israel in June.

title: Top Court Seeks Reply Of Centre On PIL Seeking Import Curbs On Yellow Peas
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday sought the Centre's response on a PIL seeking import curbs on yellow peas, which is considered a substitute to pulses, claiming its supply was affecting the livelihood of farmers.

title: Trump Urges Turkey's Erdogan To Stop Buying Russian Oil
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday urged Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan to stop buying Russian oil over the war in Ukraine, as Erdogan sought a long-awaited deal to buy US stealth fighter jets.

title: US Lawmakers Seek Answers From Firms Over H-1B Visa Use Amid Layoffs
content: US lawmakers have asked major US companies, including Apple, Amazon and JPMorgan, to explain why they are hiring thousands of foreign workers on H-1B visas while cutting other jobs, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

title: Musk's xAI To Provide Grok Chatbot To US Federal Agencies
content: Elon Musk's xAI has struck a deal with the U.S. General Services Administration (GSA) to provide the artificial intelligence startup's Grok chatbot to federal agencies, the government's procurement arm said on Thursday.

title: Suspect In Dallas Shooting Researched US Immigration Facility, Tracked Agents: FBI
content: The suspected gunman who opened fire on an Immigration and Customs Enforcement field office in Dallas had searched for apps in August that track the location of ICE agents, the FBI director said on Thursday.

title: Coaches outmaneuver NFL's defenses with court ruling on arbitration
content: two separate courts have ruled in favor of coaches' challenges to arbitration requirements . one panel labeled the league's arbitration process "unconscionable" and another called it "unworthy even of the name of arbitration" a spokesman did not provide comment, but legal analysts say the court decisions are likely to have a wider impact on the power dynamic between the league and its employees .

content: the news cycle will constantly and significantly affect the sports betting industry . our betting buzz file aims to provide fans a look at sports betting stories that are driving the conversation . the public has continuously voiced its support for the road team .

title: Celtics salute winning tradition with 'Gold Standard' City Edition uniforms
content: the uniform is dedicated to the Celtics' "timeless tradition of winning" the uniform features a white base accented with gold, with numbers and "Boston" also being featured with a gold swatch . the jersey is the first uniform in the franchise's history to not feature green .

title: College football September transfer surprises
content: the best players available in college football's transfer portal are making millions . talent evaluation is still the name of the game during the portal season . this is not exactly an early all-transfer team; we'll get to that later in the season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Mainoo linked with Man United departure
content: Kobbie Mainoo wants to leave the club on loan despite holding talks with manager Ruben Amorim . the 20-year-old is expected to push for a temporary move away from old trafford . mainoo is reported to have been informed that he is in the club's first-team plaza .

title: MLB insiders predict the playoffs: Bold takes, dangerous teams and breakout stars

title: ⚾ MLB playoff tracker, clinch scenarios
content: a number of teams are starting to shift their focus to October as the final month of the 2025 MLB regular season continues . the Milwaukee Brewers and Chicago Cubs have both clinched postseason berths, with the los Angeles Dodgers taking home the NL Central title . in the AL, the Toronto Blue Jays became the first AL team to secure a playoff spot .

title: Ohtani blasts 54th HR as Dodgers clinch NL West
content: the los Angeles Dodgers celebrated their 12th national league west title in 13 years . Clayton Kershaw said he will retire at the end of the postseason . he won the first of 14 division titles as a rookie in 2008 .

title: Top storylines to watch at the 2025 Ryder Cup
content: team USA captain Keegan Bradley and team Europe captain Luke Donald are both eager and ready for the 2025 Ryder Cup to begin Friday . the first match of the day will go off at 7:10 a.m. the parings for the first four matches will be announced Thursday afternoon .

title: Follow live: Charbonnet plows through Cardinals defenders for TD as Seahawks extend lead
content: GLENDALE, Ariz. -- The  Arizona Cardinals  host division rival  Seattle Seahawks  on "Thursday Night Football" to start Week 4's slate of games. The Cardinals (2-1) and Seahawks (2-1) hit prime time as they jostle for early position in the NFC West. Our two team reporters -- Josh Weinfuss for the Cardinals, Brady Henderson for the Seahawks -- are at State Farm Stadium, and will be keeping you updated on all the biggest plays and highlights.

title: Early-season angst check: Do Madrid, Man United, Wrexham need to be worried?
content: the offseason is for either angst or excitement, and for the nine entities below -- eight clubs and one league -- there was more of the latter than latter . let's check in on whether the angster is growing or dissipating for the motley crew of Real Madrid , Manchester City , the Bundesliga , Wrexham , Newcas .
